textBeforeTable: Australia was the favorite to win the entire event, but the way the team dominated India in the final was better than expected. The Aussies scored two goals in the first half and another two goals in the second, but it was the defensive effort that made the ultimate difference. August 3, 2014 Australia win #Glasgow2014 hockey gold after a 4-0 win over India pic.twitter.com/eTIbjwthfW— BBC Sport (@BBCSport) Not only did the Australian women’s team win the gold medal on Saturday, but the nation’s men’s team also managed to bring home the top prize on Sunday and won the 2014 Commonwealth Games' field hockey tournament. Sunday Update Robert Cianflone/Getty Images   Only four teams qualified for the medal round, and the resulting action was unforgettable once the squads took to the field. The Australian women also managed to win the gold medal. Australia was the most dominant men's team in the competition and subsequently won the 2014 gold medal, but the squad faced some very strong teams this year. The Australians beat India in the gold medal game and England beat New Zealand in the bronze medal match to finalize the podium. Despite only being introduced as a full-time event in 1998, hockey
textAfterTable: Our triumphant @Hockeyroos step onto the top step of the podium at #Glasgow2014 @AusComGames pic.twitter.com/Wlq5PWKDMi— Hockeyroos (@Hockeyroos) August 2, 2014 The war of attrition was eventually ended by the Hockeyroos after a penalty shootout. Earlier, South Africa and New Zealand tussled for Bronze. The medal ultimately went to New Zealand after a thumping 5-2 triumph.
